content:
Yes, many of the archipelago cruises from Turku offer opportunities for swimming or beach stops. If you're interested in swimming or beach stops, you should look for cruises that have longer stops on any of the islands. Some of the popular beach areas you could visit include Ruissalo, a public beach that's accessible by land or sea, or Stenskär, an island with beautiful beaches that's only accessible by boat.

Viking Line has a 5-hour "Cruise to Naantali" which includes a 1.5-hour stop at the Moomin World theme park, and you can take a dip in the nearby beaches during your free time. Turku Archipelago Tours also offers customized tours that can include beach stops, so you can tailor your itinerary to include the type of activities you're most interested in.

It's always a good idea to check with the cruise company to see if they offer these kinds of stops, and to make sure you bring appropriate swimwear and sunscreen if you plan to take a dip in the water.
